Memberships
The first strongly encouraging sign to come from the
completed questionnaires was one that showed that most research¬
ers belong to some national or regional organization. (See
Table 2.) All but 13 of the respondents listed membership in
at least one professional/ scholarly and/or research organiza¬
tion. This suggests one avenue for increased communications
cooperative efforts of such organizations to pool research
information supplied by their respective members. It is
